medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric dull pain, associated with mild dyspnea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began the day prior to presentation after eating a meal. The pain was attributed to known GERD but did not resolve despite taking GERD medications. Pain was associated with mild dyspnea and was aggravated by activity, reporting limited exertion due to right thigh pain and dyspnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (15%), atrial fibrillation, hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes mellitus, peripheral vascular disease, history of colon cancer (resection followed by chemotherapy), and anxiety/depression.
